meanings.definition: A member of a group of English Protestants in the 16th and 17th centuries who sought to simplify and regulate forms of worship.
meanings.sent1: The puritan attended church every Sunday without fail.
meanings.sent2: The puritan community gathered for prayer and hymns.
meanings.sent3: The puritan insisted on using only traditional hymns during the service.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to simplicity in worship made her a true puritan.
meanings.sent5: The puritan's strict adherence to church rules set her apart from others.

meanings.definition: A person who is strict in moral or religious matters, often to the point of being overly severe or self-righteous.
meanings.sent1: The puritan disapproved of any form of entertainment on Sundays.
meanings.sent2: She was known in the community as a puritan due to her rigid beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The puritan refused to join in the festivities, claiming they were sinful.
meanings.sent4: His puritanical views on modesty sometimes alienated those around him.
meanings.sent5: The puritan's stern gaze made others feel judged in his presence.
